channel.title: Computer Advice PLEASE
channel.description:
So, some of you saw my last post on a gaming rig and were kind enough to write back, thanks very much. Now, I realised I have another problem. MY PARENTS BE DIVORCED. So, I can't really go about building a gaming tower, one because they dont stand up well after being transported 100 times and two, it would be HEAVY. Also, I heard gaming laptops over heat REALLY easy. Help me out guys, what should I do? Can you point me in the direction of a more portable case/build? IDK. Anything is appreciated.
PS - Money is not a problem.

item.title: Computer Advice PLEASE
item.dc:creator: @xXThatOneSkaterKidXx xXThatOneSkaterKidXx
item.description:
@xXThatOneSkaterKidXx wrote:

Just keep the computer off the surface and it wont overheat. Never set it on cloth >.>

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Advice PLEASE
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

They only overheat if you’re stupid enough to cover up the fans, bed duvets seem to be common. Coming from someone who has 200 hours of Battlefield 3 game time from my laptop.

I would suggest you look at some of MSI’s laptops, try get at least a GTX 560M GPU, and don’t you dare get an AMD processor

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Advice PLEASE
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Turmoilz1337x, post:4, topic:469555”]@ Rand - Not really an option, I like having one computer for everything. Makes it easier AKA all my files etc.

@ Hash I’m looking to build one, not buy one.[/quote]

then create a network hard drive to be accessed anywhere from any computer.

edit: never mind, this only works for multiple computers on one isp.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Advice PLEASE
item.dc:creator: @Turmoilz1337x Turmoilz1337x
item.description:
@Turmoilz1337x wrote:

Where would I go to buy an external case for a laptop? Or should I buy barebones and work off of it?

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Advice PLEASE
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Then build a laptop, there’s isn’t something like an easy portable desktop setup.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Advice PLEASE
item.dc:creator: @Turmoilz1337x Turmoilz1337x
item.description:
@Turmoilz1337x wrote:

@ Rand - Not really an option, I like having one computer for everything. Makes it easier AKA all my files etc.

@ Hash I’m looking to build one, not buy one.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Advice PLEASE
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

If you want a laptop, never buy an Alienware, you’ll waste your money. You can buy good ones online for good prices and good graphics.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Advice PLEASE
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

If money is not a problem, have one at your dads and your moms

Read full topic
